['Unfed - No food has been eaten.', 'Undernourished - The body is not receiving enough nutrients.', "Malnourished - A person's diet does not provide all the necessary nutrients for good health.", 'Starving - Extreme hunger due to lack of food.', 'Famished - Very hungry, often used to describe a strong desire for food.', 'Hungry stomach - The stomach is empty and craves food.', "Inadequately fed - Not enough food has been consumed to meet the body's needs.", 'Underfed - A person or animal is not receiving enough nutrients due to a lack of food.', 'Deprived of food - No food is available or accessible.', 'Nutrient-deficient - Lacking essential vitamins and minerals necessary for good health.', "Fasting (when unintended) - Not eating due to circumstances beyond one's control, such as a medical condition or lack of access to food.", 'Empty belly - The stomach is empty, often used to describe hunger.', 'Goiter (indirectly related to left hungry) - An enlargement of the thyroid gland due to a lack of iodine in the diet.', 'Vitamin deficiency - A lack of essential vitamins, such as vitamin C or D.', 'Picky eater (can lead to hunger if not addressed) - A person who only eats certain foods and refuses others, which can limit their access to essential nutrients.', 'Food insecurity - A lack of access to enough food for an active and healthy life, due to financial constraints or other factors.', 'Underfed child - Children who do not receive adequate nutrition, often due to poverty or a lack of access to food.', "Unfulfilled appetite - A person's desire for food is not satisfied, leading to hunger and potential nutrient deficiencies.", 'Empty pantry - No food is available in the home or storage space.', 'Lean and gaunt (due to lack of food) - A person or animal appears thin and underweight due to a lack of access to adequate nutrition.']
